title: Sr. Business Analyst
job_description: Role: Sr. Business AnalystLocation: Polk City, IAJob DescriptionClient is looking to hire an experienced Business Analyst for the UI Tax Modernization Project. This individual will be part of a talented software team that works on mission-critical applications using Agile methodologies. The project aims to modernize IWD's UI Tax system by re-architecting its components to industry leading architecture and frameworks, with the goal of providing better service to both the agency staff and the end-users while positioning the agency for future technological improvements. The ideal candidate is a leader and strong team contributor who is eager to learn and develop their craft as a software professional and will find great satisfaction in the patient pursuit of excellence. This individual will be responsible for preparing gathering and validating requirements, preparing requirement and process mapping documentation, and facilitating requirements sessions with business stakeholders and leadership.RequirementsInvolvement in prior technology implementations Leading requirements gathering and validation with staff Developing requirements documentation - Use Cases Testing system functionality against requirements and specifications. Training staff on system functionality as developed. Providing general technical assistance Experience using Atlassian Suite – Jira, Confluence, etc.Background in Finance/Accounting projects

title: Business Analyst
job_description: Des Moines, Iowa (day 1 onsite)This looks to be a straight forward BA with 10 years experience for The Division of Information Technology. I know this is tougher as it's onsite, but it doesn't need any special qualifications.The Division of Information Technology (DoIT) provides adaptable, secure, and cost-effective technology services and solutions for the Department of Human Services (DHS) and its Partners. We manage all DHS IT assets, projects, and resources, as well as provide technology and expertise to support Iowa's citizens and families. DoIT does this by consistently delivering top tier performance and value to citizens as a trusted partner and service provider. Note: The expectation is that contractors will be onsite for the first 30 days before being allowed to work fully remote.Responsibilities :-Working directly with business and technical teams to gather and document requirements for various Iowa DHS systems and programs.Creating, presenting and maintaining user stories, acceptance criteria, and design documents in DHS defined systems.Documenting, tracing, maintaining, prioritizing, and assessing changes to business practices, workflows, and associated system processes.Working closely with key decision makers, system owners, and end users, in support of core activities and critical business objectives.Conducting research to query data, analyze problems, and determine solutions, such as the installation of alternate methods and procedures, implementing changes in processing methods, or the redesign of products or services.Consistently updating project information, statuses, risks, issues, and timelines for reporting purposes.Working within an agile methodology framework with a focus on delivering value while adjusting rapidly to produce the most effective outcome.Working closely with stakeholders, product owners, end users, developers, and project team members to help drive projects to successful completion.Skills And ExperienceExcellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact with a diverse group of team members, including executives, managers, IT professionals, and subject matter experts.Experience in process mapping, group facilitation, data gathering and analysis, and all phases of a project life cycle (requirements, design, development, testing, deployment, documentation, training, and measuring effectiveness.)Experience delivering software as part of an Agile delivery team.Strong ability to work effectively and autonomously against deadlines and potential priority shifts.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio.Experience with requirement gathering software such as Azure DevOps, TFS, Jira, or RTC.Ability to analyze business strategies and user needs, document specifications, and translate business objectives into proper system requirements and specifications.Guide stakeholders through business case development for new applications/functionality, including cost benefit analysis, risks and issues, and impact analysis.Ability to recognize value through benefit realization, avoidance of cost, new opportunities, and organizational modernization.Experience with continuous process improvement via underlying technologies and system support.Strong ability to break down complex concepts into smaller, simply defined tasks, while maintaining a focus on end-to-end business processes.Work closely with other Business Units to identify and deliver Enterprise value.Skilled at consulting with executive-level stakeholders to define business needs or problems.Experience providing consulting services to governmental entities is a plus.

title: Business Analyst - Market Implementation
company: Wellmark Blue Cross and Blue Shield
job_description: Company DescriptionWhy Wellmark: We are a mutual insurance company owned by our policy holders across Iowa and South Dakota, and we’ve built our reputation on over 80 years’ worth of trust. We are not motivated by profits. We are motivated by the well-being of our friends, family, and neighbors–our members. If you’re passionate about joining an organization working hard to put its members first, to provide best-in-class service, and one that is committed to sustainability and innovation, consider applying today!Learn more about our unique benefit offerings here.Want to know more? You can learn about life at Wellmark here.Job DescriptionUse Your Strengths at Wellmark as a Market Implementation Business Analyst!In this role, you will provide application and/or system subject matter expertise by supporting one or more application and/or systems for Market Implementation. This includes reviewing and scrutinizing business processes, interacting and partnering with project/program teams across Wellmark in support of business area systems. Additionally, you will perform system, process, and application production support and troubleshooting to applicable systems related to enhancements, patches, updates and/or conversions to improve processes, capabilities and efficiencies.Ideal candidates will bring a blend of technical proficiency, problem-solving skills, agile and product-centric knowledge, and business acumen to support and enhance application/system functionality. You have experience reviewing business processes, collaborating with project teams, and providing system support and troubleshooting. Strong communication, attention to detail, and adaptability come to you naturally, along with a customer-focused mindset and a commitment to continuous learning. If you're a proactive problem-solver with a passion for technology and a knack for bridging technical and business domains, check out our opening and apply today!QualificationsRequired:Associate’s Degree or direct and applicable work experience. 1+ years of business analysis or related experience, including exposure to data flow diagrams, requirement specifications, user case scenarios, and user acceptance testing (UAT). Must demonstrate ability to understand complex systems in order to develop test cases and coordinate appropriate testingEffective communication skills with the ability to articulate complex information to diverse internal and external audiencesAbility to work with and coordinate vendor responsibilities including regular conference call meetings, discussions and presentationsStrong critical thinking and problem solving skills. Ability to analyze information and evaluate complex workflows, data, and systems. Strong attention to detailFamiliarity with regulatory standards, accreditation standards, or guidelines including interpretation of technical specifications for data file and system upgradesSelf-starter with effective time management skills and the ability to organize and prioritize competing projects or tasks. Flexible and adaptable to changeCollaborative approach to work and projects with ability to partner with different business and technical areas of the companyProficiency with Microsoft Office, especially Excel. Technical aptitude to learn new software quicklyAdditional Information Responsible for one or more application and/or systems that support assigned business area(s). Provide application and/or system subject matter expertise by reviewing and scrutinizing business processes.  Collaborate and work with members of Wellmark Technology, Market Implementation, project team members as well as other stakeholders to define, analyze, plan, test, implement, maintain and document technology solutions for assigned applications and systems. Ensure process and system documentation is complete and updated and changes communicated as appropriate.  Interact and partner with project/program and technology teams. Ensure the correct stakeholders are actively participating to clarify understanding of high level business needs and requirements. Partner with members of Technology technical and project teams in the development of high-level and detailed business requirements.  Validate, analyze, test and compile business requirements for assigned system or application. Use a variety of testing techniques to document test case traceability, to ensure applications are being tested according to testing plans. Will write and execute test scenarios and update/document findings.  Keep informed, support and adhere to regulations, Wellmark’s software development lifecycle (SDLC), operational procedures and other business analysis protocols. Ensure that system conversion and application release upgrades are implemented timely with associated business requirement documentation, testing and training prior to the implementation.  May work and communicate with company resources across the organization to accomplish upgrades and/or changes to programs and systems. Assist other business staff in determining best practices for business process improvement.  Comply with regulatory standards, accreditation standards and internal guidelines, remain current and consistent with the standard pertinent to Market Implementation and covering regulations.  Other duties as assigned. An Equal Opportunity EmployerThe policy of Wellmark Blue Cross Blue Shield is to recruit, hire, train and promote individuals in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation due to a disability at any stage of the employment application process should contact us at careers@wellmark.com

title: Business Analyst
job_description: Poshan Tracker under Digital India Corporation (DIC) is inviting applications for multiple job openings at the senior level including Business Analyst, Senior System Admin, Senior Developer, Senior Designer, State Coordinator, and Senior Consultant among other technology and administrative vacancies. Interested and eligible candidates can apply on the official portal- ora.digitalindiacorporation.in before the last date 24th July 2024.Name of the post: Business AnalystNumber of vacancies: 01Roles And Responsibilities Of Business AnalystManage and Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle of the product.Develop design models based on requirements documents.Participate in requirements and design and code reviews.Troubleshoot, test and maintain the core product software and databases to ensure strong optimization and functionalitySupport the development of business and requirements artifacts that effectively model the customer’s requirements.Support system and customer acceptance testing.Participate in group improvement activities and initiatives to improve quality.Proficiently applies appropriate methodologies to design, code, test, implement and maintain systems.Prepare, write, review and maintain effective system documentationImportant LinksDownload Detailed Notification Click HereApply Here Click HereOfficial Website Click HereLast date for submission of applications: 24th July 2024 Screening of applications will be based on qualifications, age, and academic record and relevant experience.About Poshan TrackerThe ‘Poshan Tracker’ is a mobile based application rolled out by the Ministry of Women and Child Development, Government of India on 1st March 2021 through National e-Governance Division (NeGD), Poshan Tracker is an important governance tool. Technology under Poshan Tracker is being leveraged for dynamic identification of stunting, wasting, under-weight prevalence among children and last-mile tracking of nutrition service delivery.

title: Sr. Business Analyst
job_description: Berkley Technology Services (BTS) is the dynamic technology solution for W. R. Berkley Corporation, a Fortune 500 Commercial Lines Insurance Company. With key locations in Urbandale, IA and Wilmington, DE, BTS provides innovative and customer-focused IT solutions to the majority of WRBC’s 60+ operating units across the globe. title: Sr. Business Analyst
job_description: Company DetailsBerkley Technology Services (BTS) is the dynamic technology solution for W. R. Berkley Corporation, a Fortune 500 Commercial Lines Insurance Company. With key locations in Urbandale, IA and Wilmington, DE, BTS provides innovative and customer-focused IT solutions to the majority of WRBC’s 60+ operating units across the globe. BTS’s wide reach ensures that ideas and opinions are considered at every level of the organization to guarantee we find the best solutions possible.Driven by a commitment to collaboration, BTS acts as consultants to our customers and Operating Units by providing comprehensive solutions that not only address the challenge at hand, but proactively plan for the “ What’s Next ” in our industry and beyond.With a culture centered on innovation and entrepreneurial spirit, BTS stands as a community of technology leaders with eyes toward the future -- leaders who truly care about growing not only their team members, but themselves, and take pride in their employees who shine. BTS offers endless ways to get involved and have the chance to grow your career into a wide range of roles you'd never known existed. Come join us as we push forward into the future of industry leading technological solutions.Berkley Technology Services: Right Team, Right Technology, Simple and Secure.ResponsibilitiesThe Business Analyst will consult with client companies to gather business requirements to bridge the needs of the business with the use of IT. This includes determining client and organizational needs, system and operational requirements, downstream system impacts, and legal compliance obligations. Works with end users and internal staff to develop and translate business requirements for project deliverables.  Answers developer and end user questions through the development life cycle.  Completes functional testing on assigned projects.  Develops customer relationships and understands how corporation/company operates.  Clarifies and escalates issue gaps through the change control process.  Provides end-user training and product presentations.  Suggests improvements in processes used for requirements gathering, design specifications, and software implementations.  Requires an in-depth understanding of insurance related reporting and insurance company operations. Demonstrates a robust understanding of all the business data processes/processing, system interfaces, and where/how that data is used, and the related data structures.  Demonstrates understanding of data processes and/or structures.  Some travel required up to 20%. Qualifications 3 - 7 years BA/P&C/functional experience.  4 + yrs SQL experience (queries, stored procedures, functions)  Must have demonstrated the capability of meeting the key accountabilities, or have the ability to learn/perform them.  Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in related field or equivalent experience  Software Development Life Cycle experience.  Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.  Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.  Ability to quickly learn new processes and concepts.  Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment.  A self-motivated individual with a passion for success.  Strong customer and business focus.  The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer. Behavioral Skill Competencies Action Oriented  Business Knowledge  Critical Thinking  Active Learning  Written Expression  Prioritization of Work The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer.

title: Sr. Business Analyst - Finance
job_description: Who Is Pella Corporation?In the small Dutch Community of Pella, Iowa in 1925, Pete and Lucille Kuyper invested in a new invention – a window screen that rolled up and down like a shade. The couple went on to found a company based on the principles of traditional American values, integrity and the desire to enrich the homes and lives of our customers.Today, Pella Corporation is still privately owned and continues to be a leader in technology and product innovation. In fact, they've been awarded more than 150 product and design patents. And the team at Pella is as committed as ever to continuing the company's proud heritage of building innovative windows and doors.At Pella, we want to help you find what makes you an extraordinary team member. That’s why we offer individualized talent development plans, cross-functional experiences, and opportunities for career advancement through personal and professional development.Our national brand is supported by 8,000+ team members at 17 manufacturing sites and 90+ sales branches across the country who are dedicated to serving our customers with Pella Passion — a way of being that inspires us to go above and beyond for each other, our customers, and our communities. Pella Passion has guided our actions for 95 years and will carry us forward as we capture the rare blend of inspired design and exceptional detail in our work and our lives.JOB SUMMARY:Works with internal business partners and external resources to provide Finance/IT application systems that enable functional processes. Has system wide responsibility on Finance/IT projects. Provide subject matter expertise to solve functionally sophisticated problems. Provide direction to team members and coaching to junior level employees.ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:Percentages represent guidelines only; May vary by position and fluctuate due to changing business needs. 45% Day to day support - Support current business systems including issue identification and resolution, functional performance monitoring and tuning and disaster recovery capability to meet business objectives leveraging both user feedback and internal metrics to drive improvement. 20% Analysis and design work - Analyze business requirements, develop design, manage configuration and integration, and conduct robust testing to support new system implementations, current system upgrades and business process changes and CI initiatives. Work to be reviewed with Sr. Analyst or manager. 10% Reports and Metrics - Extract and format data to support reporting and metric needs. 10% Project management – Development and coordination of medium projects or complex components for larger projects 10% Documentation and Training - Create and maintain documentation and conduct end user training. Educate users in workflow, business processes, and reporting metrics enabled by system. 5% Advanced Support - Support other team members by providing industry expertise on difficult and complex issues. Supervisory Responsibilities: None Responsibilities outside of normal business hours: Shared support, scheduled maintenance and disaster recovery assignments. Other duties may be assigned.The Senior Business Analyst – Finance/IT will be involved in all aspects of Financials and Information Technology from the design and implementation of processes to the day to day support.Liaison between the finance user group and the appropriate IT groups. Advocate for finance group with regard to the financial applications (Oracle E-Business Suite (R12 or Fusion) Microsoft (Great Plains or Business Central) and integrated systems (ex. Vertex, Kofax, Fenevision, PrefSuite, Paradigm etc.)Works closely with managers, other IT implementation teams, and business customers to prioritize and fulfill project goals.Responsible for creating an environment of cooperation and teamwork which supports the identification and timely completion of projects. This would include, but is not limited to, training support, monitoring progress, and communication among Pella and customer teams.May be responsible for supervision of support resources, coordinating testing scenarios, and tasked with managing customer relationships in assigned areas.Support day to day activities with strong troubleshooting skills and including on-call rotation.Manage reporting tools, including Power BI and XML Publisher.Work with users to identify business process issues/requirements and prepare recommended cost effective solution to maximize value provided from business applications. Decipher functional processes and communicate both to technical as well as business resources.Identify\implement process improvements and automation opportunities.Participate in defining financial systems strategy, including choice of appropriate tool set, and participate the phases of the system evolution including business requirements gathering to functional and technical specifications and analysis, configuration, testing, implementation of Oracle and trainingSupport management through ad hoc data collecting, reporting, analysis and special projects.Technical / functional skills (includes computer skills):Experience with Oracle E-Business Modules. Preferred experience specifically in Oracle Finance Modules or equivalent: GL, Receivables, Payables, Cost Management, Tax, Cash Management and XML Publisher. Preferred experience and knowledge in OneStream, Great Plains, Business Central, Anaplan, Vertex etc.Preferred functional knowledge of additional Oracle E-Business suite Modules: Inventory, Supply Chain, Purchasing, Order ManagementWord, Excel, Outlook, Power Point, Power BI, Oracle Support and SR creation. Familiarity with Oracle applications modules and high level database structure. Ability to read, modify and create basic Oracle queries. Ability to read PL\SQL code for troubleshooting and design requirements.Familiarity with application setups necessary for forms, reports, workflows, etc. as well as knowledge of flex fields, value sets, lookups, and concurrent processingStrong leadership, organization and project management skills, and the ability to speak in front of groups of customers and/or employees.Certifications or licenses: Financial related education &\or experience with an in-depth knowledge of: Oracle Financials (AP, AR, GL, FA, PO)Travel expected: 0-10% of timeQUALIFICATIONS: Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years related functional experience. Leadership Competencies:Manage and improve processesDemonstrate AdaptabilityIndustry KnowledgeBuild relationshipsDrive ExecutionHigh Impact Delivery

title: Strategic Sourcing Analyst
job_description: Looking for a work culture that values hard work, service, and having a good time? Look no further than Casey's! Our commitment to treating people the way they want to be treated is at the heart of everything we do. We take pride in caring for our guests, our communities, and each other, while staying true to our roots. Join us in building a better future for ourselves and our business as a Strategic Sourcing Analyst!The Strategic Sourcing Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and managing sourcing data analytics including historical spend, contract metrics, supplier KPI's and market research. The Sourcing Analyst will also support and collaborate with the sourcing team and cross functional stakeholders in preparing, managing and execution of RFx events.What You'll Do:Collect and analyze historical and forecasted spend data to contribute insights and identify sourcing opportunities.Look for trends within category, assesses vendor capabilities, develop alternate sources, and evaluate vendor performance and develop sourcing strategies and tactics.Perform market research to identify best-in-class vendors that could fulfill our material and service needs.Prepare and manage Request for Quote/Proposal/Information (RFX) process to obtain vendor quotes and proposals to objectively vet leading candidates capable of offering a best-value solution.Support cross function teams with the development and execution of RFx events in Coupa.Collaborate with internal stakeholders in supporting their sourcing needs and provide necessary guidance with regards to procurement processes.Prepare and maintain accurate internal reports on key performance indicators and sourcing performance metrics.Manage internal contract and risk matrix tracking and retention program and identify gaps and areas of risk.What you can expect when you join the Casey's Team:A transformative culture putting service first and taking pride in caring for our guests, our communities, and each other.Opportunities to use cutting edge technologies and enterprise-wide collaboration to enable our strategy and drive world class service.The right balance between work and life, to do your best work and enjoy those important personal moments. Ask about our options for workplace flexibility that may be available.We're here for families! Great benefits including choices in medical plans, dental, vision, life insurance, employee stock purchase program, charitable giving programs, parental leave, AND an onsite Child Development Center.Competitive pay, 401k company match up to 6%, vacation & sick time, paid holidays, volunteer time, and an onsite cafeteria.Dress for your day dress code, jeans are welcomed!The opportunity to work for a big company that has not lost our small company feel. Our senior leadership team is engaged, involved and accessible!What are you waiting for? Come be a part of a company that is growing, transforming and is here for good!What You'll Bring:Bachelor’s Degree in operations/supply chain management/business, or equivalent relevant work-related experience required.At least two years of experience in sourcing and procurement for direct/indirect categories, with a preference for experience in the convenience store, restaurant and/or distribution industries.Ability to maintain strong relationships across various functions, demonstrating the value-add of leveraging cross-functional expertise and support for adoption.Mathematical/statistical abilities for cost optimization of the supplier portfolio while balancing trade-offs.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with proficiency in data analysis toolsAbility to use e-sourcing and contract management tools for effective implementation of sourcing process for categories within scope.Proficient using PC-based applications (such as Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and/or Access).Any relevant certifications in the area of procurement and supply chain (CPIM / CSCP / CPSM / CIPS) are a plus.

title: Operations - LEAD Rotation Program
job_description: These elite multi-year programs are for future leaders looking to make a tangible impact, build relationships, and get exposure to CRST’s culture while building on the necessary skills to continue to grow within CRST. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset, enjoy relationship-building, embrace change, and think innovatively, we want you to apply today!  CRST’s Leadership Development Rotational Programs are a unique opportunity for high-potential, early-career professionals to develop essential leadership skills while learning end-to-end operations throughout our business. The programs offer opportunities to explore roles and experiences that give you direct exposure to and interaction with senior leaders across the business. They are designed for those ready to fast-track their career development. The programs also provide support for career growth and exploration through development opportunities, mentoring, networking, and a strong program community.   Operations - this 2-3-year program (dependent on how quickly you progress) offers hands-on experience to prepare experts in operational leadership. You’ll gain experience in customer service, planning, fleet management, and pricing/design.  Here’s the best part: no transportation-specific experience is necessary!  Our experienced mentors will be your guide to learning the business and managing operations sized to give you exposure to our industry, processes, customers, and tools. It’s designed to continually grow the scope of work through increased responsibilities, including managing larger accounts, working with a varied customer base, and growing your experience in leading teams.   You can expect to evaluate KPIs, build a high-performing team, and promote profitable growth. In this position, you will be able to advance quickly while receiving professional development and training. CRST has more than 100 locations across the country, providing learning and job opportunities in a variety of locations.    Here’s what you can expect:   Apply analytical skills to evaluate business resultsContinuously improve business processes to promote profitable growth Develop your skills through various projects and assignments to quickly identify your functional strengthsBuild industry competence while refining leadership skillsDevelop lasting relationships with CRST mentors and leadersEngagement in a program that invests in your future Be considered for new assignments and opportunities geared toward agile, high-achieving, talented early-career employees (that could include relocation considerations) Upon completion of the program, you’ll be prepared to step into an operations leadership position responsible for a team managing gross revenue or gross costs of at least $10M. You will work closely with your mentor to ensure that post-program placement aligns both with your interests and business needs.    Program Requirements: We are looking for recent graduates with bachelor’s or master’s degrees in Business Management, Business Analyst, supply chain management, procurement, logistics, operations management, and other related fields.Minimum GPA: 2.5 on a 4.0 scale. Individuals who demonstrate tenacity, and perseverance, and are eager to take on complex challenges while accelerating their careers.  Natural leaders who build relationships with trust and transparency. With each milestone achieved program participants will have opportunities to progress. This may require participants to relocate. Relocation opportunities come with growth and a bigger scope of responsibilities.  For this position, CRST does not currently, nor in the future, provide sponsorship for employment visa status. Work locations of each position will be determined during the hiring process. Each work location will depend on business needs and the essential functions of the position. The CRST Core Values: Safety at the Core of All We Do - Integrity in Every Decision and Action - Commitment to the Success of Employees, Customers, Agents, Contractors, and Communities. EEO Statement: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Business Relationship Manager
job_description: DescriptionPosition at HNI CorporationHNI Corporation is a global family of brands for the workplace and home dedicated to enhancing the spaces where we live, work, and gather. We pride ourselves on fostering an environment where we make a positive impact on others; upholding our beliefs in integrity, inclusion and belonging.Your Impact Starts the Day You Do!What We NeedThe Business Relationship Manager is a partner to the business, responsible for enhancing our business capabilities by developing and deploying technology solutions that support key business functions. This role partners with a specific area of the business to understand its current processes, systems and tools and works to enhance IT capabilities to increase productivity, reduce costs, and support the medium and long-term IT roadmap.The Business Relationship Manager role will serve as a hands-on liaison between business units and the IT Department. While the Director will focus on broader strategies related to IT transformation, this role will break down strategic initiatives into discrete projects and work with IT professionals, serve as a project leader, and drive implementation, upgrade, and transformation projects toward completion.This role will focus on technology and software solutions supporting the areas of business responsible for finance and accounting.What You Will DoWork with the director to understand the IT roadmap for the supported areas of the business; drive progress against the roadmap by coordinating with cross-functional teams and partners.Collaborate with IT, finance and accounting, as well as third-party vendors to support and enhance the software tools that facilitate cost accounting, financial planning, corporate, and operational accounting and the aggregation of financial data. Partner with the finance and accounting teams to understand their processes and how HNI’s suite of financial applications supports them. Ensure that underlying systems are properly configured, and the application integrations into the broader IT environment deliver end to end functionality and robust and accurate data. Understand HNI’s corporate structure and how costs, revenue, and profits are allocated and tracked. Manage small to medium size projects, enhancements, and service requests following standard methodology from initiation to closeout. Work with internal partners to design, develop, and maintain new and existing interfaces between systems and technologies.Participate in the design, development, testing and deployment of applications; work with internal IT department to resolve application problems.Coordinate, test, and implement system improvements by gathering and documenting requirements, writing functional specifications, testing new configuration, and overseeing the deployment to production. Lead business users through quality assurance processes including building test plans and performing tests for system changes, fixes, patches, and upgrades.Perform day-to-day administration and maintenance activities including monitoring service desk tickets for issue resolution and enhancement requests.Communicate with the business partners; provide updates on tickets, projects, and issue resolutions. Serve as a point of escalation and ensure the appropriate level of urgency to obtain resolution. What You’ll ALSO DoMonitor systems to ensure continued operations and reporting efficiency and work with internal IT department to resolve software and hardware problems.Recommend system design changes and upgrades based on efficiency and user needs.Maintain documentation for standardized processes and systems.Evaluate the best way to use system functionality to meet business and user requirements.Drive process improvement to maximize efficiency and effectiveness of processes and systems.Identify and communicate risks and provide recommendations for risk mitigation.Analyze and evaluate new tools, software, and systems, as directed.What You HaveBachelor’s degree in Accounting, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.3+ years of experience in a role that provides service or application support to a functional are of a business, with regular interaction with technical and non-technical partners.5+ years of overall experience in Information Technology, as a business analyst, or as a project manager (PMP) in an enterprise environment.Previous experience working with or supporting accounting software and technologies such as Oracle EBS, Oracle ERP Cloud, OneStream, Bloomberg Tax and Fixed Assets, or Hyperion.What You’re Good AtSolid understanding of operational accounting, corporate accounting, cost accounting, and financial reporting, including GAAP.Strong project management and organization. Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and deliver results on-time and on-budget.Strong interpersonal skills to communicate with technical and non-technical users and maintain vendor relations.Strong analytical skills to solve problems efficiently.Ability to understand, analyze and communicate technical designs, project issues, and status.Exercise sound judgment and determine appropriate actions.Understand cross-team impacts and engage key business partners in decision making.Ability to prioritize work, excellent organizations skills and initiative to improve processes.Advanced Excel skills (ex. Pivot tables, VLOOKUP’s, etc.)We look forward to hearing from you!HNI Corporation (NYSE: HNI) is a manufacturer of workplace furnishings and building products, operating under two segments. The workplace furnishings segment is a leading global designer and provider of commercial furnishings, going to market under multiple unique brands. The residential building products segment is the nation’s leading manufacturer and marketer of hearth products.As one of the larger employers in Iowa, HNI Corporation was recognized in 2018, 2019, and 2020 for the diversity of our Board of Directors and was named in 2020, 2021, and #6 in 2022 as one of America's Most Responsible Companies by Newsweek.How we act today protects how we live tomorrow. Check out our CSR Report here: https://www.hnicorp.com/social-responsibilityDiversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), are not just core beliefs at HNI - they are operational imperatives. To learn about all the benefits HNI has to offer visit www.HNIbenefits.com.We also invite you to visit us at www.HNICorp.com to learn more!Our company endeavors to make www.hnicareers.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at 563-272-7400 or via email at [email protected]. title: Data Analyst - Business/Service & Product Performance - Global Customer Service - All Genders
job_description: A family-owned company, bioMérieux has grown to become a world leader in the field of in vitro diagnostics. For 60 years and across the world, we have imagined and developed innovative diagnostics solutions to improve public health. Today, our teams are spread across 45 countries and serve 160 countries with the support of a large distribution network.Come and join a family-owned global company with a long-term vision, and a human-centered culture.We are looking for a Business Analyst who will work and grow within the Global Customer Service department/unit and will report to Global Customer Service Operations Vice President within a team of 5 co-workers.What will your responsibilities be within bioMérieux? As a Products & Services Performance Analyst within the Global Customer Service Operations department, you will be responsible for analyzing the performance of products and services across our immunoassays, molecular biology, Data & IT, and microbiology ranges. You will work cross-functionally to consolidate performance indicators and contribute to the strategy for improving customer satisfaction and operational performance within our teams. Participate in the collection and analysis of data necessary for product definition and evolution.  Collaborate with the data science and product teams within Global Customer Service Operations to produce relevant analyses of product-related complaint data, identifying trends that highlight potential performance issues.  Structure and disseminate information regarding the performance of our products and services, focusing on key performance indicators (KPIs) for customer service.  Identify deviations from objectives, consolidate and track action plans at a global level, supporting product teams in executing these actions.  Participate in the facilitation of a "G-CSO & Product Performance" community to encourage the exchange of best practices.  Create reports and integrate them into various communication channels for relevant stakeholders, including department management, regional and local service managers, R&D, Vigilance, and Marketing.  Serve as the administrator of the Salesforce platform for G-CSO. Who are you? University degree at Bac +5 level, preferably in sciences and/or business, with a keen interest in data analysis.  Minimum of 5 years of experience in business, business analysis, data science, or other roles with a strong analytical component and a service and/or business-oriented mindset.  Proficiency in tools such as Sales Force CRM.  Proficient in SQL language for importing and managing data in databases.  Knowledge of Python programming language.  Familiarity with common Data Visualization and Business Intelligence methods and tools such as Tableau.  Experience in service activities would be a plus.  Fluent in French and English, with the ability to work cross-functionally and a problem-solving attitude.  Ability to work in project mode, quickly acquire mastery of new tools, methodologies, and concepts, and deliver quality results bioMérieux welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

title: Treasury and Payment Solutions Card Product Analyst
job_description: HTLF is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.HTLF is a diversified financial services company headquartered in Denver, Colorado. We deliver community banking at scale by powering our geographically diverse group of banks with technology, efficiency and strength — giving local decision-making the opportunity and insights to focus on customers and growth. Relationships have been the core of our company since its founding in 1981. We're deeply invested in the communities we serve, and that's why our clients choose us as their banking partners.What's different about a career at HTLF? We believe our employees and their diverse backgrounds, perspectives and skills are our greatest assets. We wouldn't be HTLF without the people with whom we surround ourselves and empower to enrich the lives of our customers, employees and communities. We're dedicated to making HTLF the best place to work – where your opinions are valued, your feedback and ideas are heard, and your opportunities for personal growth and professional development are endless.Under direction of the Commercial Card Senior Product Manager, the Treasury and Payment Solutions (TPS) Card Product Analyst will play a role in the development, management, and optimization of our card products and services. This includes assisting with planning, organizing, and directing the development and maintenance of commercial/business card projects from conceptual stages through product life cycles. Additionally, the TPS Product Analyst will assist with gathering industry and competitive data including products, pricing and customer response for all HTLF markets. Occasional travel required.Primary ResponsibilitiesIn collaboration with assigned Product Managers, communicates with various business lines the proposed new product or enhancement of a product as a part of the discovery process for research and development. Coordinates with and helps to educate Sales, Implementations and Bankers as to what the new product or forthcoming enhancement will be along with associated timing of execution.Meets with assigned Product Managers frequently to ensure timeliness of updates to the Product Roadmap and Product Project Plans so that key milestones are achieved, and deliverables are provided prior to deadline.Aids in preparation and review of primary and secondary research to provide direction for TPS pricing, delivery, product design and customer adoption.Prepares initial training material of new products and product enhancements to position the sales team for success in growing/retaining business.Prepares and modifies or assists with preparation and modification of the development of sales collateral and customer training/on-boarding materials and tools used by the sales team.Ensures timeliness of review of all contracts and materials for training purpose internally and externally by working closely with the Marketing and Legal Departments.Ensures product profitability for assigned products and assists with data preparation and key milestone activities for the annual TPS pricing review with all banks.Assists in and works closely with operations to finding solutions to growing customer needs.In collaboration with assigned Product Managers and Product Team Manager, develops recommendations on product bundling, capabilities, segmenting, and pricingProvides estimates of product profit potential.Develops competitive analyses and pricing models to formulate recommendations and parameters for pricing implementation in various markets. Builds pricing models as needed.In collaboration with assigned Product Managers and Product Team Manager, assesses product lines’ abilities to meet market needs and business units’ objectives and develops or proposes product solutions where gaps exist.Provides consulting services “as product expert” to sales people for customer presentations/sales and all company business lines in support of strategic initiatives.Identifies and monitors competitors with competing products, pricing and customer response for all HTLFmarkets.Partnering with Operational departments for programming product specifications.Maintains relationship with Sales, Implementations and bankers for integrating sales practices.In collaboration with assigned Product Managers and Product Team Manager, assists with establishing marketing objectives for each product.Assists in writing technical product descriptions for internal and external use.Collaborates with a wide variety of functional areas to develop and provide product information responsive to customer needs and market opportunities.Completes annual E-Learning Plan and Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) training as assigned and keeps up-to-date knowledge of BSA as it relates to the job function.Secondary ResponsibilitiesEnsures that HTLF policies are followed, controls are utilized, and the product management methodology is followed to prevent audit findings. If audit findings occur, collaborates with assigned Product Managers and Product Team Manager to ensure they are remediated prior to deadline.Performs other duties as assigned.Management ResponsibilitiesThis job has no management responsibilities.QualificationsBachelors preferred or Masters preferred or Equivalent experience preferred1-3 years experience in bank operations, marketing, financial product development and/or research and interpretation of data required1-3 years Treasury Management and/or Commercial Card Payments specifically preferredGeneral knowledge of TM products, payments, risk management, relative compliance and commercial banking preferredExcellent interpersonal and customer facing skills - strong written and verbal communication skills requiredStrong presentation and training skills preferredAbility to function effectively in matrix management environment preferredAbility to multi-task/facilitate various tasks for multiple projects at the same time requiredGeneral understanding of marketing and data needed to manage business growth preferredKnowledge of banking database software, statistical measurement software such as SPSS, Microsoft Office software including Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project and Access preferredScheduled Weekly Hours40Time TypeFull timeThe Targeted Salary For This Role Is$65,480.00 - $85,124.00You may also be offered incentive compensation, and benefits. Benefits may include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Health Savings Account, Paid Time Off. Actual compensation may vary based on geographic location of the specific role as well as work experience, education, and skills of the selected candidate.

title: Analyst II, Quality Engineer - Supply Chain
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Introduction/About the TeamAs a global leader in supply chain, the engineering division is a new development for Walmart with the mission of continuous growth as the Fortune 1 company and to maintain a competitive advantage. The Analyst II, Quality Engineer has a direct impact by being a part of an engineering team that collaborates closely with operations on the floor to observes processes, and work with associates and the process engineer to develop and troubleshoot analytical tools to improve the business.You'll make an impact by... Conducting root cause analysis to strategically improve the process.  Extract data and manipulate into beneficial tools to provide key metrics for process improvement.  Build relationships with operations to identify top loss and recognize causes.  Deploying projects from start to finish.  Work with project manager for newly deployed tools.  Be an influential leader.  Develop blue sky ideas. You'll sweep us off our feet if you... Are an agile learner and can implement what you learn.  SQL experience to provide review of processes and recommendation for systems improvement.  Proficient understanding of BigQuery.  Microsoft SQL Server experience.  Informix experience.  Microsoft PowerApps experience. This role is not sponsorship eligible.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.Benefits & PerksBeyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity EmployerWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people.At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.‎‎‎You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.‎For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .‎‎Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.‎Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.‎For Information About Benefits And Eligibility, See One.Walmart .‎The annual salary range for this position is $50,000.00-$100,000.00‎Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Bonuses.‎Additional Compensation For Certain Positions May Also Include‎ Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location)‎ Stock‎‎Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or prior experience in Quality or Process ImprovementMicrosoft Office Suite, analytical skillsPreferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.Co-Op/Internship in Manufacturing, Supply Chain, or Distribution with experience applying basic Lean/Continuous Improvement Tools, Possess applied knowledge of a functioning Quality Management System elements including Statistical Process Control, FMEA, Quality KPIs, etcPrimary Location...1501 E MAPLELEAF DR, MOUNT PLEASANT, IA 52641-3106, United States of America

title: Government Relations Senior Analyst
job_description: We are Athene. At Athene, we are driven to do more. We are a leading retirement services company that issues, reinsures and acquires retirement savings products designed for the increasing number of individuals and institutions seeking to fund retirement needs. We see every day as a new opportunity to measure ourselves against the best - and then we don't stop until we've set the bar even higher. We're ready to help you achieve more.PurposeJoin Athene, a financial services leader at the forefront of industry transformation. Navigate the dynamic landscape of regulatory and policy changes with our high-performing team. As a Senior Government Relations Analyst, you'll play a vital role in safeguarding our interests and shaping the future of the sector.AccountabilitiesMake a lasting impact:Engage as a regulatory expert: Conduct in-depth research on state and federal legislation, staying ahead of industry trends and anticipating potential risks and opportunities.Coalition Building: Assist with trade association engagement, including monitoring issues, positions, and contributing to related strategic positioning. Craft compelling insights: Analyze complex regulatory issues, turning them into clear, concise memos, reports, and presentations for key stakeholders.Lead with agility: Manage diverse workstreams and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.Be a strategic partner: Proactively identify challenges and offer innovative solutions, demonstrating a "can-do" attitude and a commitment to excellence.Why Athene?Industry leader: Be part of a Fortune 500 company shaping the future of ret.High-impact role: Make a tangible difference in shaping policy and navigating regulatory shifts.Thriving team: Collaborate with a diverse and supportive team of global experts in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Growth opportunities: Develop your skills and expertise through mentorship and challenging projects.Qualifications And ExperienceBachelors degree, plus a minimum 5 years of relevant work experience: Demonstrate a proven track record of success in a related field.Industry familiarity preferred: Prior experience operating in a law firm, accounting firm, consulting firm, trade association or regulator, or insurance company environment is a plus.Advanced educational background (desired, not mandatory): A Juris Doctor, CPA, or actuarial training will further strengthen your candidacy.Communication mastery: Captivate your audience with exceptional writing and communication skills.Organizational powerhouse: Maintain impeccable organization and manage administrative tasks with ease.Team player thrives in chaos: Collaborate effectively in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple workstreams seamlessly.Drive. Discipline. Confidence. Focus. Commitment. Learn more about working at Athene.Athene is a Military Friendly Employer! Learn more about how we support our Veterans.Athene celebrates diversity, is committed to inclusion and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.PDN-9b4498b6-402a-4ed3-82c7-d363a27d1076

title: Senior Treasury Analyst- PowerBI
job_description: Job Description - Senior Treasury Analyst - Power BIWells Fargo's Balance Sheet Interest Rate Risk Management (BSIRRM) Group is looking for a highly motivated individual with Power BI(or similar) experience to help the group transform the way we do reporting and analytics using QRM, CALM and other associated data systems.The BSIRRM Group performs quantitative analysis of the balance sheet behavior and has primary responsibility to measure interest rate risk (IRR) and design corresponding risk mitigation strategies. Team members oversee the IRR simulation models, provide management with insight concerning changes that they see in the risk profile, and contribute to the generation of risk management strategies.This is a key role in our transformation strategy to adopt Power BI in the group. We aim to:Enable better, data-driven decision-making by providing highly contextualized data and analytic information through cohesive workflowsAutomate the existing, fragmented "human integration layer."Foster Collaboration across functional teamsProvide streamlined Governance and Control of analytical information presented in risk/regulatory deliverables To achieve this mission, this role will be responsible forResponsible for administering, supporting, monitoring, and tuning the Power BI reporting environment; This involves the management and administration of all components of the Power BI domain, including Power BI on-premise data gateway servers.Support self-service model governance - PBI transformation SharePoint site, access groups, training plans, playbook updates etc.Run meetings and various collaboration forums - manage agenda, meeting proceedings and action itemsOwn requirements for standards for the group - standardized hierarchies, calculations, naming conventions etc.Support all desktop procedures and control requirements in PBI environmentOwn and manage the report inventory, PBI report inventory and the corresponding progress metricsSupport L3 (level 3 production support) for all PBI production issuesWorks closely with Power BI report users to tune and optimize Power BI reports and dashboards.Serves as Best Practices resource for Power BI initiatives in the organization.Provide data management documentation as needed to support projects/initiatives.Support oversight requests - data lineage, data research (Ex: Audit, CMOR, IT&V etc.)Provide monthly communications to downstream partners for all the changes.Monitor production metrics to escalate operational risks to Risk forum (through KPI Deck)Required Qualifications, US:4+ years of Treasury experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education*Minimum QualificationsExpertise with Dimensional Modeling or creating SSAS tabular models.Experience producing Power BI data models and recommending best practices for the creation of reports and graphics/visualizations.Understanding of Power BI Service and governance best practices, including CI/CD and use of deployment pipelines.Experience in the infrastructural and technical areas involving data sourcing, ETL (Extract, Transform and Load), data quality, MDM (master data management) and data distribution.Knowledge of software development process and methodologiesUndergraduate degree in technology, MIS, business or related field or equivalent experienceStrong and effective interpersonal communication (written and oral), organizational, and customer service skills.Ability to interact effectively with a variety of contacts/relationships, including executive/senior-level managers.Preferred SkillsPower BI certification is added advantage.Prior financial services industry experienceExperience in moving an organization along the data management maturity model curveKnowledge of QRM, IRR models, data management policies, and risk data aggregation methodologies for reporting and decision support.MBA or other business related graduate degreeKnowledge of data integrity management efforts in Corporate Finance/Treasury or other lines of businesses.Experience with enterprise initiatives supporting regulatory mandatesPosting End Date:5 May 2024Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.We Value DiversityAt Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions.
